member.name: T:SmartLocalization.Editor.HOEditorUndoManager
member.summary:
Editor undo manager. To use it:
Store an instance in the related Editor Class (instantiate it inside the OnEnable method).
Call undoManagerInstance.CheckUndo() BEFORE the first UnityGUI call in OnInspectorGUI.
Call undoManagerInstance.CheckDirty() AFTER the last UnityGUI call in OnInspectorGUI.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.Editor.HOEditorUndoManager.#ctor(UnityEngine.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new HOEditorUndoManager, setting it so that the target is marked as dirty each time a new undo is stored.
member.param: The default you want to save undo info for.
The default name of the thing to undo (displayed as "Undo [name]" in the main menu).

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.Editor.HOEditorUndoManager.#ctor(UnityEngine.Object,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new HOEditorUndoManager.
member.param: The default you want to save undo info for.
The default name of the thing to undo (displayed as "Undo [name]" in the main menu).
If TRUE, marks the target as dirty each time a new undo is stored.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.Editor.HOEditorUndoManager.CheckUndo
member.summary: Call this method BEFORE any undoable UnityGUI call. Manages undo for the default target, with the default name.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.Editor.HOEditorUndoManager.CheckUndo(UnityEngine.Object)
member.summary: Call this method BEFORE any undoable UnityGUI call. Manages undo for the given target, with the default name.
member.param: The you want to save undo info for.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.Editor.HOEditorUndoManager.CheckUndo(UnityEngine.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Call this method BEFORE any undoable UnityGUI call. Manages undo for the given target, with the given name.
member.param: The you want to save undo info for.
The name of the thing to undo (displayed as "Undo [name]" in the main menu).

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.Editor.HOEditorUndoManager.CheckDirty
member.summary: Call this method AFTER any undoable UnityGUI call. Manages undo for the default target, with the default name, and returns a value of TRUE if the target is marked as dirty.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.Editor.HOEditorUndoManager.CheckDirty(UnityEngine.Object)
member.summary: Call this method AFTER any undoable UnityGUI call. Manages undo for the given target, with the default name, and returns a value of TRUE if the target is marked as dirty.
member.param: The you want to save undo info for.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.Editor.HOEditorUndoManager.CheckDirty(UnityEngine.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Call this method AFTER any undoable UnityGUI call. Manages undo for the given target, with the given name, and returns a value of TRUE if the target is marked as dirty.
member.param: The you want to save undo info for.
The name of the thing to undo (displayed as "Undo [name]" in the main menu).

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.Editor.HOEditorUndoManager.ForceDirty
member.summary: Call this method AFTER any undoable UnityGUI call. Forces undo for the default target, with the default name. Used to undo operations that are performed by pressing a button, which doesn't set the GUI to a changed state.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.Editor.HOEditorUndoManager.ForceDirty(UnityEngine.Object)
member.summary: Call this method AFTER any undoable UnityGUI call. Forces undo for the given target, with the default name. Used to undo operations that are performed by pressing a button, which doesn't set the GUI to a changed state.
member.param: The you want to save undo info for.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.Editor.HOEditorUndoManager.ForceDirty(UnityEngine.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Call this method AFTER any undoable UnityGUI call. Forces undo for the given target, with the given name. Used to undo operations that are performed by pressing a button, which doesn't set the GUI to a changed state.
member.param: The you want to save undo info for.
The name of the thing to undo (displayed as "Undo [name]" in the main menu).

member.name: T:SmartLocalization.Editor.MiniJSON.Json
member.summary: This class encodes and decodes JSON strings. Spec. details, see http://www.json.org/ JSON uses Arrays and Objects. These correspond here to the datatypes IList and IDictionary. All numbers are parsed to doubles.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.Editor.MiniJSON.Json.Deserialize(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the string json into a value
member.returns: An List<object>, a Dictionary<string, object>, a double, an integer,a string, null, true, or false

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.Editor.MiniJSON.Json.Serialize(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts a IDictionary / IList object or a simple type (string, int, etc.) into a JSON string
member.returns: A JSON encoded string, or null if object 'json' is not serializable

member.name: T:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.GenericListAdaptor`1
member.summary: Reorderable list adaptor for generic list.

remarks.para: This adaptor can be subclassed to add special logic to item height calculation. You may want to implement a custom adaptor class where specialised functionality is needed.

member.name: F:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.GenericListAdaptor`1.fixedItemHeight
member.summary: Fixed height of each list item.

member.name: P:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.GenericListAdaptor`1.List
member.summary: Gets the underlying list data structure.

member.name: P:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.GenericListAdaptor`1.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets element from list.
member.returns: The element.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.GenericListAdaptor`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IList{`0},SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListControl.ItemDrawer{`0},System.Single)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .
member.param: The list which can be reordered.
Height of list item in pixels.

member.name: T:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor
member.summary: Adaptor allowing reorderable list control to interface with list data.

member.name: P:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor.Count
member.summary: Gets count of elements in list.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor.CanDrag(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether an item can be reordered by dragging mouse.

remarks.para: This should be a light-weight method since it will be used to determine whether grab handle should be included for each item in a reorderable list.
Please note that returning a value of false does not prevent movement on list item since other draggable items can be moved around it.

member.returns: A value of true if item can be dragged; otherwise false.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor.CanRemove(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether an item can be removed from list.

remarks.para: This should be a light-weight method since it will be used to determine whether remove button should be included for each item in list.
This is redundant when is specified.

member.returns: A value of true if item can be removed; otherwise false.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor.Add
member.summary: Add new element at end of list.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor.Insert(System.Int32)
member.summary: Insert new element at specified index.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor.Duplicate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Duplicate existing element.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor.Remove(System.Int32)
member.summary: Remove element at specified index.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor.Move(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Move element from source index to destination index.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor.Clear
member.summary: Clear all elements from list.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor.DrawItem(UnityEngine.Rect,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draw interface for list element.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor.GetItemHeight(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets height of list item in pixels.
member.returns: Measurement in pixels.

member.name: T:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListControl.ItemDrawer`1
member.summary: Invoked to draw list item.

remarks.para: GUI controls must be positioned absolutely within the given rectangle since list items must be sized consistently.

example.para: The following listing presents a text field for each list item:

member.returns: The modified value.

member.name: T:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListControl.DrawEmpty
member.summary: Invoked to draw content for empty list.

remarks.para: Callback should make use of GUILayout to present controls.

example.para: The following listing displays a label for empty list control:

member.name: F:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListControl.defaultContextHandler
member.summary: Default functionality to handle context command.

example.para: Can be used when adding custom items to the context menu:

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListControl.AddItemsToMenu(UnityEditor.GenericMenu,System.Int32,SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor)
member.summary: Invoked to generate context menu for list item.
member.param: Zero-based index of item which was right-clicked.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListControl.HandleCommand(System.String,System.Int32,SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor)
member.summary: Invoked to handle context command.

remarks.para: It is important to set the value of GUI.changed to true if any changes are made by command handler.
Default command handling functionality can be inherited:

member.param: Name of command. This is the text shown in the context menu.
Zero-based index of item which was right-clicked.
member.returns: A value of true if command was known; otherwise false.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListControl.DoCommand(System.String,System.Int32,SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor)
member.summary: Call to manually perform command.

remarks.para: Warning message is logged to console if attempted to execute unknown command.

member.param: Name of command. This is the text shown in the context menu.
Zero-based index of item which was right-clicked.
member.returns: A value of true if command was known; otherwise false.

member.summary: Add item at end of list and raises the event .

member.summary: Insert item at specified index and raises the event .

member.summary: Duplicate specified item and raises the event .

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListControl.RemoveItem(SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor,System.Int32)
member.summary: Remove specified item.

remarks.para: The event is raised prior to removing item and allows removal to be cancelled.

member.returns: Returns a value of false if operation was cancelled.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListControl.ClearAll(SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.IReorderableListAdaptor)
member.summary: Remove all items from list.

remarks.para: The event is raised for each item prior to clearing array and allows entire operation to be cancelled.

member.returns: Returns a value of false if operation was cancelled.

member.name: T:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListFlags
member.summary: Additional flags which can be passed into reorderable list field.

example.para: Multiple flags can be specified if desired:
example.code: var flags = ReorderableListFlags.HideAddButton | ReorderableListFlags.HideRemoveButtons; ReorderableListGUI.ListField(list, flags);

member.name: F:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListFlags.DisableReordering
member.summary: Hide grab handles and disable reordering of list items.

member.name: F:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListFlags.HideAddButton
member.summary: Hide add button at base of control.

member.name: F:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListFlags.HideRemoveButtons
member.summary: Hide remove buttons from list items.

member.name: F:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListFlags.DisableContextMenu
member.summary: Do not display context menu upon right-clicking grab handle.

member.name: F:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListFlags.DisableDuplicateCommand
member.summary: Hide "Duplicate" option from context menu.

member.name: F:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListFlags.DisableAutoFocus
member.summary: Do not automatically focus first control of newly added items.

member.name: F:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListFlags.ShowIndices
member.summary: Show zero-based index of array elements.

member.name: F:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListFlags.DisableClipping
member.summary: Do not attempt to clip items which are out of view.

remarks.para: Clipping helps to boost performance, though may lead to issues on some interfaces.

member.name: T:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListGUI
member.summary: Utility class for drawing reorderable lists.

member.name: F:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListGUI.DefaultItemHeight
member.summary: Default list item height is 18 pixels.

member.name: P:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListGUI.indexOfChangedItem
member.summary: Gets or sets zero-based index of last item which was changed. A value of -1 indicates that no item was changed by list.

remarks.para: This property should not be set when items are added or removed.

member.name: P:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListGUI.currentItemIndex
member.summary: Gets zero-based index of list item which is currently being drawn; or a value of -1 if no item is currently being drawn.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListGUI.DefaultItemDrawer``1(UnityEngine.Rect,``0)
member.summary: Default list item drawer implementation.

remarks.para: Always presents the label "Item drawer not implemented.".

member.param: Position to draw list item control(s).
member.returns: Unmodified value of list item.

member.name: M:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.ReorderableListGUI.TextFieldItemDrawer(UnityEngine.Rect,System.String)
member.summary: Draws text field allowing list items to be edited.

remarks.para: Null values are automatically changed to empty strings since null values cannot be edited using a text field.
Value of GUI.changed is set to true if value of item is modified.

member.param: Position to draw list item control(s).
member.returns: Modified value of list item.

member.name: T:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.SerializedPropertyAdaptor
member.summary: Reorderable list adaptor for serialized array property.

remarks.para: This adaptor can be subclassed to add special logic to item height calculation. You may want to implement a custom adaptor class where specialised functionality is needed.

member.name: F:SmartLocalization.ReorderableList.SerializedPropertyAdaptor.fixedItemHeight
member.summary: Fixed height of each list item.

remarks.para: Non-zero value overrides property drawer height calculation which is more efficient.

member.summary: Event handler for getting the available translation languages for an Automatic Translator

A list of all the available languages

member.summary: Event handler for translating a single string with an Automatic Translator
member.param: If the translation was a successful operation
The key of the translated text. Used for identification

member.name: T:SmartLocalization.Editor.TranslateTextArrayEventHandler
member.summary: Event handler for translating an array of strings with an Automatic Translator
member.param: If the translation was a successful operation
A list of the translated keys. The indices in this list correspond with the list of translated values.
A list of the translated values. The indices in this list correspond with the list of keys.

A list of strings to translate. Make sure the indices correspond with the list of keys.

The language code to translate to
